utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: Hey, I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Take your time. You mind if I get a drink of water?

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: No, not at all. Help yourself.

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: Not exactly beach reading, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Do you understand any of that stuff?

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: Well, most of these I can get through, But, uh, that one? Can't get past the dust jacket. Where's Ted?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Laid off. Company's going with per diem workers. You know, you don't have to pay overtime, health insurance.

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: Wow. that sucks.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I don't mind. really, I'm not a 40-hour-a-week kind of guy. Uh... If I could just get you to sign.

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: Right. um... Hang on one second. I want to show you something. You're gonna laugh, but, uh, I swear, this guy James Sidas looks exactly like you. Wait, hang on a second. This guy is you. I saw a profile Nova did on you. You're, like, the youngest guy to ever graduate MIT?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Standards were lower back then.

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: You got an IQ of 178. Published three books and 35 papers all before the age of 18?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Yeah, uh, sorry, I really need to get going. So if I could just get you to sign off.

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: All right. I'll trade you. I'll sign if you'll sign.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I'm not that guy anymore.

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: Come on, man. This is the most exciting thing that's happened in this place in years. Come on. Don't be like that. I'm paying you a compliment.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: It's... It's not that, um... My hand's not working.

utterance.speaker: Beringer
utterance.content: Hey, hey. Whoa, whoa. You okay?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Put it on Dr. Wilson's tab.

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: I don't know who Dr. Wilson is, and we don't have tabs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you know who I am?

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Cashier
utterance.content: But, sir –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I got it. It's all right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thanks. Although I should make it clear that for two bucks all you get is top half, over the clothes. Any plans for turkey day?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Go to my sister's for dinner. Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just making pleasant conversation. I've heard tell of folks doing such.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How 'bout we talk about this? 15-year-old. Recurring migraines and blurred vision.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure. There's no point in putting a band together if we're not gonna play any gigs.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hold on. Take this instead. I was expecting more resistance.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was the old me. New me is static-guarded and friction-free. Enjoy your drumstick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ready to save some lives? 32-year-old courier. Ataxia, anemia, mild cough. CT was clear. Tox screen negative.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What're you so excited about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why wouldn't I be? Got all my starters back, plus a couple of first-class free agents. I feel like Mike Tomlin. Probably not as much as you do, but you get the idea.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Ataxia and anemia could be viral. Maybe West Nile?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No fever, lymph glands were normal. Anybody seen Wilson?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hyperbilirubinemia?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, like that's a real thing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Meningitis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anemia's a stretch. Page Dr. James Wilson at 558.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about sickle cell?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Guy's white.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Whites can get it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on. We get the tennis elbow and all the money. Let them have sickle cell.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: TTP's a better fit.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He's right. What, you thought I wouldn't agree with him? Ever?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You didn't agree with him. That's why he dumped you. Oh, sorry. It was mutual.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're cool, okay? Nobody's angry, nobody's hurt.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sounds passionate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: TTP makes sense to me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not to me. What if he had a history of –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One big, happy family. TTP it is. Confirm with a blood smear and adamts13 antibodies.

utterance.speaker: Voice on PA
utterance.content: Dr. James Wilson, please dial 558.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Can you cure it?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: TTP isn't completely curable, but the symptoms are manageable with the proper treatment.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Is this the treatment?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, first we need to do a blood test to confirm the diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: But he's gonna get better.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Honey, that's what she's saying. I'm gonna be okay. Don't worry.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I'm gonna be fine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're sure everything was fine before? Given your educational background, you'd think you could at least find a job with a medical plan.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: We have money. Don't worry.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not that, it's just – I want to make sure we have all the information we should.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: My husband wouldn't lie.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: It's okay, baby. He's just doing his job. He just wants to make sure I’m not a secret drug addict or an alcoholic.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or hiding a history of mental illness?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I work as a courier because I want to. It's easy. I don't have to think.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's too hard to think.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: No, just unpleasant. No matter what I did, it really wasn't good enough. Then I met Dara. She didn't care how smart I was or what I might accomplish in the future. It was the first time in my life that I was really happy. So I decided I would rather be happy than smart.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You all right? Sorry. I know you're not okay. I mean...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She left. Went back to Chicago.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Any chance of reconciliation?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sure you don't want to grab a drink after work? Figured we could talk about the perils of dating doctors.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I wasn't dating Cameron.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know what you're doing and I appreciate it, but I've got it under control.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's what you said about the Dibala incident. And obviously you didn't.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And talking about it obviously made things so much better.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Didn't you think there was something weird about that guy?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Not really. In fact, he seemed pretty normal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's my point. Guys with IQs off the chart are usually completely... abnormal.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Speaking of House, why'd you come back? I mean, you must've taken a major pay cut.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Life's too short to worry about money.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Your wife feel the same way?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's happy to cut back on some things... like sex. Why'd you come back?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Why wouldn't I? Like Foreman said, nobody's angry. Nobody's hurt. Schistocytes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That means TTP.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Which is what we thought it'd be. Remember? This is a good thing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is an easy thing. And House doesn't take cases that are easy, which means it's not TTP, and he wants to see how long it takes us to catch up to him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Schistocytes suggest TTP.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good. Now what?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Normally, we'd try plasmapheresis, but the patient has an albumin colloid allergy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So that means we have to give him a splenectomy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, it does.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson?

utterance.speaker: Man in stall
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you know where he is?

utterance.speaker: Man in stall
utterance.content: Not in here.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're sure you want us to take out his spleen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that what a "splenectomy" is? I thought it was an ice cream treat. Yuck.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So you do really think he has TTP? You're not just testing us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, like I have time for games.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So why did you really take this case?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Isn't it obvious? I'm fishing for a dinner invite.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Missed you at breakfast this morning. And lunch.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I had a dentist appointment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know where Cuddy's sister lives?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You see. This is why I don't answer your urgent pages. Because they're not urgent pages.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've decided what I’m gonna do about Cuddy and Lucas. I'm going to break them up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's given me a purpose in life, a goal, a raison d’être.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Albeit a selfish, mean-spirited, childish raison.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ehhhhh. I think of it more as benevolent. There's only two possible outcomes for their relationship. They split, or they stay together forever. If it's split, then the sooner it happens the better for everyone. If it's stay, then my meddling won't matter. In fact, if they survive it, it might even make their bond stronger.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How you manage to elevate your narcissism to beneficence is masterful.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And I’ve decided to do it at Thanksgiving dinner. Just 'cause I’m sentimental. Dinner is at Cuddy's sister's, which brings us back –

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, don't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I fished for an invite. Cuddy wasn't biting, so I'll have to crash.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I have no idea where Cuddy's sister lives.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ask and thou shalt receive.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You can't honestly think I would help you with this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not help me, help Cuddy, remember? If you don't get it, I'll be forced to use more nefarious methods.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Happy holiday.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Huh. Looks great.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: So he's all better?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Probably be on some long-term meds, and he's about ten ounces lighter. Other than that, won't even know it's gone.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Did you hear that, honey? You're gonna be just fine.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: When can I get out of here?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Everything checks out, less than a week.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Good, 'cause those boxes aren't gonna deliver colors.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Colors?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Green... and orange... and ceiling.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mr. Sidas, do you know where you are?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Chewing.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Jimmy?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Shirt...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's stroking. Call the cath lab now.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Blood flow's restored. There appears to be no permanent damage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good news is it turns out to be an exciting, action-packed thrill ride of a case after all.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bad news is we took out his spleen for nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank God he's still got his appendix and tonsils. So what looks like TTP, acts like TTP, tests like TTP, but isn't TTP?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: CNS vasculitis. Explains ataxia, and anemia, maybe the stroke.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: CT would've picked up something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Greg House, a friend of your sister, Lisa.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Could be DIC.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lisa Cuddy. Sorry. Wrong number.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You gonna ask?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm sure he's got a perfectly logical explanation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can't be DIC. No hemorrhaging. And I’m calling all 12 Julia Cuddys within a 100-mile radius.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: See? Completely reasonable. Acquired pancytopenia.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: WBC's normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, Julia. You're, uh – you're Lisa's sister, right? You sure? 'Cause you are number 12.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Maybe she got married and changed her name.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Otis Campbell.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably kept her first name.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The mnemonic for toxins. O for organophosphates, T for tricyclics, I for insulin…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Except the tox screen was negative.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Standard tox screen. Unstandard toxins don't show up on it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you two do an unstandard tox screen; you two search his home. Otis Campbell's got to be hiding somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Smartest guy in the world, and this is the best he can do.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe he's doing what he loves. Delivering boxes was a childhood dream.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Soda, processed cheese, marshmallow spread. Nothing in here is capable of going bad.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ibuprofen, eye drops, cough syrup.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You want to come over for Thanksgiving dinner?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You never asked me over before. Why now?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I just never thought of it. But now that we're both on the team...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And my wife left me?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is that a bad reason?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. But, uh, I’m okay. On both the food and friends.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Mice. Leptospirosis could explain the ataxia and the anemia.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But not without a fever.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You have someone to talk to?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What, you want names? Look, you lost a friend. I get it. But I’m not Kutner.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Good, 'cause Kutner never used to come over for dinner.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm gonna pretend there's something interesting over here so you'll shut up.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Actually, there is. He's got sketches of atomic structure. This one's full of math proofs.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They're all old. Nothing since '96.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This isn't some homework assignment his parents forced on him. This is passion. Why would he want to stop doing this?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Marriage destroyed his soul. Ooh. Or maybe it was just the booze.

utterance.speaker: Diana
utterance.content: Thank you, doctor, you've been wonderful.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As have you, Diana. Be well.

utterance.speaker: Diana
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're helping. Voluntarily.

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: He's done six already.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Figured you might be getting backed up. The holiday season and all.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So which one of us slipped through the wormhole into an alternate dimension?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have always loved to travel. And paint. Lucky number seven.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House... I know you're trying to be nice, but I also know you're doing it because you have an agenda.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Sexy and smart. Lucas is a lucky guy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The question is, is this a bad agenda or a good one? Either you're trying to screw with me, or you're trying to show me that you've really changed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So which is it? I’m dying to know.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are you doing for Thanksgiving dinner?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Peace in our time. It cost me 45 minutes of clinic duty.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is a three-hour drive. Have you considered the possibility that this is a fake address?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think she'd send me to a vacant lot for Thanksgiving dinner?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If she's smart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She is. That's why I ran it through motor vehicles. Good as gold.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This cannot end well.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't want it to end well. You should come as my date. You're not gonna want to miss this.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The unstandard tox screen was as clean as the standard one.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But we found vodka stashed away in his place.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What's with the ties?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Makes me look adorably non-threatening. Party or party hearty ?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Liver failure would explain all the symptoms. Party.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So guy's a brainiac, and his secret drug of choice is booze? That's kind of pedestrian, don't you think?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Talk to him. He's a pedestrian guy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: With pedestrian alcoholism. Liver biopsy can wait until after Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, assuming the biopsy's gonna tell us exactly what we expect it to tell us, it can wait till after New Year's. On the other hand, Taub and Thirteen can do the liver biopsy today.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why us?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Juniority. Welcome back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What do you want us to do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Same as me. Have a Happy Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I'm not an alcoholic.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, you just hide vodka around the house for fun.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I drink, just not a lot.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Since when do you drink at all?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I have one shot when I get home from work, baby, that's it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So why lie to your wife about it?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Because it's not important. What difference does it make?

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: That you drink every day by yourself?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I have one lousy drink, okay? Have you ever seen me drunk? Ever?

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: No, but you've obviously been drinking enough to hurt your liver.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: My liver is fine.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Hold still.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There we go.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: This test is a waste of time.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Ta-dah! Hey.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Want some wine?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: All right. Very good. Here, we got this.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: String beans?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Julia?

utterance.speaker: House Sitter
utterance.content: No, I’m the house sitter. They're in Hawaii for the week.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Happy Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Happy Thanksgiving, you guys.

utterance.speaker: House Sitter
utterance.content: You must be Dr. House. I was told I should offer you a turkey sandwich.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Tuna salad. Closest thing they had to turkey.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thanks. But I’m hoping I can still get out of here to catch the tail end of dinner with my wife.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No cirrhosis, no scarring, no infection.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Blood panel?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Elevated albumen: 7.2.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everything else is fine.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So it was a waste of time.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Unless… it's not his liver that's elevating his albumen, it's his kidneys.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Renal failure. Explains the anemia. If he developed hyperkalemia, that would explain the ataxia. But the stroke?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ischemic encephalopathy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Nice. Except now we have to stay and test his kidneys.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Key under the mat.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: There's no key under the mat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, right. You need to replace one of your kitchen windows. I helped myself to your wine cellar. I'll leave a buck on the way out. You're not right for her.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: And you are?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Less wrong.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then I started thinking... What was I saying?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You were saying it's late, and...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She invited me. She didn't know if she should. She was trying to figure out if I really have changed or... if I’m still the same old S.O.B. I've always been. But she always gave me a chance. 832 chances. And I used up every one of them. 832's her limit. Make a note.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: How 'bout a cup of coffee? It's just instant, but...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm pathetic. I don't deserve her.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Okay, okay, all right. Uh, here. Maybe you should crash here. It's a sofa bed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I love her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Patient’s liver’s fine. It’s his kidneys that are shot. And where the hell is House?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He left a message on the machine. He’s not coming in today. So what causes kidney failure?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Rhabdomyolysis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No edema. I trust you had a wonderful Thanksgiving?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't remember. So I guess I did. Multiple myeloma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No bone pain.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You got drunk alone?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. That would be a sign that I need to talk to you about this. Polycystic kidney disease?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No UTIs or flank pain.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, what if his cough is more than just a cold?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He hasn't been coughing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's in his history, and we found a new bottle of cough syrup in his medicine cabinet.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cough could mean Goodpasture syndrome. Affects kidneys and lungs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Start him on immunosuppressors and dialysis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We'll do it right after we run it by House.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's not answering his pager. Looks like he's leaving it up to us.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Us, not you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And since we don't disagree, you can save your fight for another case.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: How long do I have to be hooked up for?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Four to six hours a day until we see an improvement.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: What if you don't?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then we keep doing it until he gets a transplant.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: You were sure it was his spleen, and then you were sure it was his liver, which he told you it wasn't, and now you're sure it's his kidneys.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's definitely his kidneys. We just don't know why it's his kidneys.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Any word from Cameron?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I started seeing a counselor after my diagnosis. She's really good.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why does everyone assume that everyone works in the exact same way?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We pretty much do. Our egos want us to think we're all snowflakes, no two alike, but really we all want the same things. Love, forgiveness... chocolate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, what I want is for everyone to leave me alone. How do I get that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What did you say to Lucas last night?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know there were a lot of consonants. I don't remember how I got here, never mind what I said.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, I just talked to him. And he said he thought it'd be better if we stopped seeing each other. Said he didn't realize how much there still was between you and me, and he didn't want to get caught in the middle of us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was drunk. Whatever I said, he can't really –

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I've had enough, House. I actually felt bad about scamming you. But then you lived down to my expectations and then some. There is no "us." There never will be.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It worked.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Please tell me you're talking about a medical procedure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They split up this morning. You're the very first one I've told.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And you think she'll start dating you? I'm sure she hates you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But her eyes say, "How will I ever pay you for that tennis lesson?"

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ah, what a shame.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They'll get over it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I meant for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll get over it faster than they do. Can't believe that Lucas fell for my "I never say this because it's so personal except that I’m drunk" profession of love. Second-oldest trick in the book.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're right. It's his fault because he's stupid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He certainly is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're stupid.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Well, I’m rubber, and you're glue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not pedestrian, he's stupid. At least stupider than he should be. He's a DXM junkie.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Dextromethorphan. As in cough syrup?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He wasn't taking it for his cough. It's cheap, available at your corner drug store, and taken in high doses, it's a dumb drug.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Dumb drug. Well, he obviously hasn't –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's smart compared to you. He's a moron compared to what he was. "Robotripping." Lowers the IQ. It also causes brain damage. Unless taken with the proper amount of ethanol. About one drink per day. He wasn't abusing the booze and taking the cough remedy medicinally. He was abusing the cough meds, and taking the booze medicinally. Bravo.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Why would you do that? If you had a – a gift, why would you just throw it away?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I didn't throw it away. I just turned it down a little. When my brain was on low, everything didn't seem so miserable anymore. Life was bearable.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: I thought that I did that.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: You do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Long-term abuse of DXM explains all your symptoms. Even – oh, sweet irony – your cough. Whole bowel lavage, activated charcoal. We get all traces of it out of your system. You'll be the unhappiest little courier in no time.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I don't think I can live without it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'd be surprised what you can live without. Make him a genius.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: I can't believe it. He looks so much better already.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: We were thinking about calling GQ.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lavage has removed all traces of DXM from his body.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: You're drawing again. What is it?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Just doodles.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: No, it's not. Come on, Jimmy, I want to know.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: This is a toroidal helicon plasma device. It determines the amount of energy expended by the subatomic particles. I’m thirsty. Could you get me a juice or something?

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Yeah, of course. I'm so happy, jimmy.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I told you. Do you know what the difference between her IQ and mine is? 91 points. In relation, she's closer to a gibbon than she is to me. Having sex with her would be an act of bestiality.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I assume you didn't marry her for her skill in applied physics.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I just wish she could spell it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You really think you'd be happier with someone who could spell better?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: No. That's the problem. I’m the one who's a jerk. But I owe her everything. I want to want to be with her. And when I’m clear, I... I can't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fainting, dizziness, shortness of breath?

utterance.speaker: Ronnie
utterance.content: Sometimes. Is the wait always this long?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only on days that end in "day." Diarrhea, weight loss?

utterance.speaker: Ronnie
utterance.content: A bit. Don't you ever shave?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. once a week. How 'bout you? Stomach pain, tenderness?

utterance.speaker: Ronnie
utterance.content: Every now and then. Are you this rude to all your patients?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, yes! Don't think you're special. So we've got a lot of vague, unverifiable symptoms. Yet all the physical signs are perfectly normal.

utterance.speaker: Ronnie
utterance.content: What do you think I have?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not sure, but I think it's... a lame job.

utterance.speaker: Ronnie
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're a rat. Insurance company sends you out to check on the quality of medical care.

utterance.speaker: Ronnie
utterance.content: That's ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is it really? 'Cause you seem a lot more interested in asking questions than answering them. Handwriting on your medical records is obviously not a doctor's 'cause I can almost read it. And when you went out for a urine sample, I looked in your purse. Found the list of questions you were supposed to memorize before you came to the clinic. I was looking for gum.

utterance.speaker: Ronnnie
utterance.content: You're an ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Put it in your report. I tell you what. I'll give you 20 bucks if you'll pretend that I’m not when we leave this room.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Remember, first ice, then heat. If you have any problems, don't hesitate to call me.

utterance.speaker: Ronnie
utterance.content: Thank you, Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wait a second. Where's Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: Gone for the day.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey! Sorry. I can't remember if I've mocked you yet for being a male nurse.

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: I think this counts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fair enough.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: That isn't the man I married.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yes, he is. He's just smarter. Give him some time. I’m sure –

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: He hates me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His body is going through withdrawal. He's adjusting.

utterance.speaker: Dara
utterance.content: Maybe he never loved me. Not really. Maybe we never really had anything at all.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Somebody help! I can't feel my legs. I can't feel my legs. Anywhere. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We have to talk about this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It's late. I’m tired.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know it's a big pay cut, but I'll always have the chance to make money. I won't always have the chance to do this job.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That's what you think? That it's about the money?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So it's that I didn't consult you before I took the job?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That was offensive, but it's not about that either.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So then... Can you give me the first letter?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: When we got married, you were an intern working 30-hour shifts doing grunt work. And we both put up with it because we knew that it was leading to something better. In your private practice, you are the boss. You call the shots. But now you're 40 years old, you're still doing grunt work.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's what this is about? You think I’m a wuss?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He made you miss Thanksgiving dinner.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Vitamin B12 deficiency? Gives us anemia, numbness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not a stroke.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If he has a vascular malformation – Anemia's not macrocytic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry to inconvenience you. Dying patients can be so thoughtless.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Don't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great comeback. Is that Oscar Wilde? Come on, people.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Bone marrow malignancy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wouldn't produce schistocytes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lupus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gee, thanks for coming in. ANA was negative. What about you? Got any predictable drivel you'd like to add?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I think they've given you enough already.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, at least they're trying. They're not just sitting there like roadkill. Give me something. Give me something, or I'll get your ex-smarter half on the phone and ask her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're gonna be pressing charges?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Against the ottoman I tripped over?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Against Chase.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm pretty sure the ottoman was acting alone. You free for dinner this weekend?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: At least three other people saw him do it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mass hysteria. Either night?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I can't have doctors punching each other out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God, who got punched?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And more importantly, for Chase's sake, I need to know if he's able to handle himself or if I should be getting him some help.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase couldn't have punched anyone. He was with me when I tripped over the ottoman. If you're not planning on eating this weekend, maybe a movie?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not doing this, House. It's not fun anymore. Just do your job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need your help.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: What happened to your face?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was mowing the lawn when the phone rang. You're a computer. I’m gonna feed you data, and you analyze it.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: What, are you gonna feed me 20 years of medical knowledge too? It's not gonna work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. But I don't have anyone else to ask.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: It's lonely, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not that bad.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Then you're not that smart. You ever tried to kill yourself?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not quickly.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: I did. 12 years ago I jumped off the top of my eight-story building into a dumpster bin the day before pickup. I broke my collarbone, my leg, and three ribs. When I was in the hospital they put me on narcotics and suddenly everything was just better. I didn't feel isolated or lonely. That's where I met my wife. She was so happy. And dumb. And I was... smart... and miserable. You tell me who the genius is. I fell in love with her buzzed out of my head, and I knew I wanted to stay that way forever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Enjoy.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Easier on your conscience if I die an idiot?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's a conscience? Which ribs... did you break in the fall? They on the left side?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Yeah, bottom three. That was 12 years ago.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This probably cost me my marriage, so it better be awesome.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Ferrous oxide contrast?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gets absorbed by the spleen. Unless he doesn't have one. In which case it's absorbed by the liver, and fries that.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're killing him?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You think I opened him up and didn't take out his spleen?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All organs do look kind of the same – red and squishy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Accessory spleens.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay, that is amazing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 12 years, eight stories, and a dumpster ago, he broke three ribs, damaged his spleen. Bits of it split off, circulated through his bloodstream until they landed and attached somewhere else.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So it is TTP. I just didn't remove... all of his spleens.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 16 splenectomies. Pretty sure he gets a set of steak knives with that.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I can outrun you. Sorry about the nose. And the eye. And the, uh... eyebrow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guess I deserved it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, if I thought that, I wouldn't be apologizing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your fist slipped?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Everybody kept bugging me, asking if I was okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you busted my nose to keep people off your back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Making people even more worried about you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe. But at least they're not talking to me about it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fair enough.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't be so grateful. You'll be delivering packages for 70 years to pay for it.

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Well, uh, thanks for our talk. It's been a while since I had a stimulating conversation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what're you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Go back to my life.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Which one?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: The one that has my wife in it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Robotripping. How's she feel about that?

utterance.speaker: Sidas
utterance.content: Well, she doesn't have to know. It's worked for 12 years.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell your brain I said good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Einstein is giving himself a lobotomy, and you're cool with that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ignorance is bliss.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hold that pose. I'll start with t-shirts and mugs, and see how it goes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Home early.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What happened to him? You beat up House?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Just one right hook.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why? What happened?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You were right. I told him we need to lay down some ground rules, got a little heated.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That's not what I meant. Is he okay? Are you gonna be fired? Arrested?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everything's fine.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy. Can we at least be civil?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How's your nose?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's okay. Does your kid like animals? I got tickets to that holiday carnival. I hear they have a nice petting zoo.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I think I was pretty clear before.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't mean with me. Here. Take 'em. Enjoy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, thanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They're not fake. I didn't steal them. One of the nurses was selling 'em for her kid's scout trip. I know it doesn't make things right between us, but I just wanted to do something nice.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't want them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'll see you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They didn't split up. She wouldn't take the tickets.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Of course. Windtalker code for "we never split up." House, she told you multiple times she wants nothing to do with you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I wasn't gonna be there. She just felt guilty that I felt guilty, so she couldn't take them.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Either that or she didn't want to appease you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: These weren't reparations. Just a simple gesture of remorse, and she slapped it down. They didn't break up. She just wanted me to think that so I’d back off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Dare I ask what you're gonna do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing. I said they'd either break up or they'd stay together. They didn't break up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And you're okay with that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It is what it is.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aah.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House knows I lied.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Why? What'd he say?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Nothing. I could just tell.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You want to stage another breakup?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. Oh, hi. It seems like he's gonna leave us alone.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not completely sure.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: So, we have his blessing?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I guess so.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: I made you some eggplant Parmesan. Maybe House isn't so bad after all.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That would be nice, wouldn't it?
